H3.text: when did the first train run in england. 1804

A4.text: The Stockton and Darlington Railway opened on 27 September 1825.

A5.text: The first purpose-built passenger car, Experiment, was attached and carried dignitaries on the opening journey.

A6.text: The first locomotive-hauled public railway opened in 1825.

A7.text: Canterbury and Whitstable Railway (1830) – First steam-hauled passenger railway to issue season tickets.

A8.text: The first recorded steam-hauled railway journey took place on 21 February 1804.

A9.text: The first full‑scale working railway steam locomotive was built by Trevithick in 1802.
